text: [Music]
my name is bill eul's I work at the
National genomics infrastructure in
Stockholm and I'm headed facility for
the development group we're part of sie
life lab or sites like laboratories
that's a national platform for Sweden
providing research and support for
researchers in life sciences we do
everything to do with genomics research
group to come to us with samples that
they've taken in patients or animals or
things which are interesting we process
those samples to extract the DNA and we
sequence up DNA which finds using
analysis work to help them out and give
them something that can live and work
with the cost of DNA sequencing has
really dramatically dropped over recent
years
so as the cost drops we're producing
more and more data which makes it
difficult to scale up so having a region
for AWS in Sweden is important for us we
transfer very large quantities of data
see latency is important having rapid
uploads and downloads for and already
helped us loosely service the best of
all the tools but AWS provides really
enable us to do cost effective and easy
to scale analysis currently with our
analysis some of the bottlenecks are
memory usage and disk i/o so we can't
speed that up just by buying a better
and faster service but we can speed it
up by parallelizing so that infinite
scalability helps us to run the same
analysis faster
having data in the cloud really helps us
with cutting-edge research we have a
larger and larger data sets reproducible
science is key so having it in the cloud
enables us to share data the better
reproducibility of the better
comparisons and makes it easier for
researchers to continue their research
now
you
